text: The sandwich I ordered was sooo delicious and people working here are really kind. I especially really like the idea of selecting what we want on the paper bag, since I am an anxious person when it's about ordering food, haha. I definitively never go to subway again. I found my new favorite sandwich place !

Wow...I'm so glad I found this place on yelp. It's officially, this is my wife and I's sandwich shop. You can create any kinda sandwich you want. I know most people would say you do that at any shop but this place has many choices of ingredients that  will make you come back to create something new.
Now, when you go there for the first time it may be overwhelming because you don't know the ordering process. Once you figure it out you'll love it. 

Go here NOW!!!

I used to eat at Which Wich in Colorado, but kind of forgot about it when I moved to Las Vegas. My girlfriend is all about Jimmy Johns, and they're ok, but when I saw there was a Which Wich not too far from where I lived, I couldn't wait to try it.  I wasn't disappointed. I'm a vegetarian, and this is one of the few sandwich places I can get something other than bread, mayo and grilled onions (I'm looking at you, Subway). My go to Wich is a black bean patty on wheat with lots of feta.  The menu can be a bit daunting at first, but the staff at Wich Wich will walk you through, and they do it in such friendly way, you don't feel too self conscious your first time.  I'm a fan of Which Wich, especially this location. Stop by and grab a Wich sometime. You'll love it.

Love this place!!!! Best sandwich place in Vegas. The staff is really nice, store is clean and they offer me water cup while I wait for my food which I really appreciated since it's too hot. I drive 10 miles everyday to get my salad here. I wish they had more locations.

One of the best sandwich shops around. You fill out your order on the outside of the bag that they'll put your sandwich in, so you don't have to watch them like a hawk and get your order right. If you're a picky eater like me that's a big deal. I get the chicken sandwhich in just the regular size. They will toast the sandwich for you so it comes out delicious. Just like Quiznos only not going out of business.

Their chocolate chip cookies are amazing! They run them through the oven too. These people should be running a bakery with their chocolate chip cookie game. My only complaint is that they don't like to stock bottled sodas. I prefer that to the fountain soda. It just tastes different to me.
You've gotta try the wicked!!! I've filled two of their punch cards on just the wicked sandwich....it's a must try
This was our first time here and we would definitely come back again. We had great service from the friendly staff and our sandwiches were really tasty too :)

Four stars for the food.  The bread is great and there are tons of choices of meats and toppings.  Everything on our sandwiches tasted really fresh and the cookies were deeelish.  Service was good.

I love the way you order by checking things off of the list on your sandwich bag so no one can misunderstand your order and get it wrong.  The teeny tiny area in which you fill out your list, however, is kinda ridiculous... especially during the super busy lunch rush.  And there's not a whole lot of seating, either. 

I'd go back, though.  Hopefully next time I can go before/after the big lunch crowd.

I was very disappointed with my experience at Which Wich.  I entered the store, was not greeted, and not told how to order a sandwich. The store was not busy to justify being ignored.  Once I figured out the ordering system I ordered the ruben sandwich with double meat.  I got the combo and the total came to $10.50. Thankfully I had a free sandwich coupon, but that is a lot of money.  I was not offered a cup for my soda and had to ask for one.  A few minutes later I got my sandwich which was suprisingly light.  My instinct told me that there was something wrong, but I ignored this and took my sandwich back to my office.  I opened up the sandwich, plenty of meat, no dressing, no sourkraut.  I called the restaurant to complain.  The person on the phone was sufficiently apologetic and offered me a free sandwich, but the damage was already done.

There is no reason to eat here again.  I'll be eating at Capriotti's.

Easily the most disgusting meal I have ever tried to eat in a restaurant. My husband and I decided to grab lunch, he suggested the Which wich based on the yelp reviews. I ordered the Reuben which was a new menu item. I ordered the sandwich hot. There was only one other person in the store, they were not busy. When I received the sandwich, the cheese was not even melted, calling it luke warm would be kind. When bit into the sandwich I could not physically bite through it because it was like biting into a piece of grizzled shoe leather. To say it was fatty doesn't even begin to describe the texture. So, to be fair, I tried the other half, same deal. So gross. I then threw the sandwich away. The boy behind the counter asked me how the sandwich was and I told him. He said "oh, ya, the meat looked really fatty and the pieces that were in there didn't looked wrapped right, and there wasn't a lot of meat." At that point all I could do was stare at him in disbelief that he essentially told me he was A) to lazy to cut new meat for my sandwich B) he opted to put what he described as "not wrapped right meat" on a sandwich and serve it. What does that mean not wrapped right?!? Like not to health code, like bad meat?!? Then the manager comes out and the kid's sort of back peddling and says to the manager "they didn't do a very good job last night." To which the manager responds "yeah, well they were really busy." 
WOW... Not once was I offered compensation, apology or any other reason to ever eat at that lousy place again. Save yourself the trouble go somewhere else even the crappiest chain sub shop I can think of has better service and food.

One of my favorites because of all the options + sweet tea. This particular location is so slow. Limited seating. Took 20 minutes to get my sandwich while standing around waiting. 3 guys working, only 1 making sandwiches.

Blows subway out of the water FASHO! 
Workers are always very kind and the place is always kept tidy. I order a lot of different toppings and they never get it wrong. huge plus is they will wrap your sand which in lettuce if you wana be a skinny girl and it tastes delish

The Superfood Wich is bomb.  I'll definitely be back to try the other offerings.
Order online if you're in a hurry.

This started out as a 5 star review a few hours ago. Service was fantastic, sandwiches delicious. I got the buffalo chicken my husband the bac-hammon. Within 2 hours we are both sitting here very sick. Something was contaminated! The only two items that were the same on our sandwiches were mayo and provolone. So it was that or someone failed to wash their hands. Sorry, but after this incident i don't think we will be returning :(
Love this place! It's only 5 minutes away from my place and it's so good and unique! Going here more often.

Today was our family's first time at this sandwich shop. Family consisting of our 9yr, 2yr, my husband and myself.
 We walked in where there were few guests and an extremely unwelcoming employee just standing at the register.
We looked around as to how the place worked. We told the cashier we'd never been there before.
The cashier said fill out a bag and give it to me. I wanted the gyro but there wasn't a bag for that. I just wrote it on the back of one. My husband wanted the meatball sandwich so marked it. Our girls wanted on and j and filled out theirs. Cashier takes the bags and we sit. We had to ask for our drinks. He gives a tokens but we had no clue what those were even for. We had to ask about that too. 
So now with no other orders in you'd think ours would be in the works. Not quite. There was one other employee whi was sharing phone pics as the two were making jokes and laughing I was curious how that was more important than starting our order. We quietly sat waiting and listening to how the one employee couldn't wait to get off to go Capriotti's sandwich shop. Sounded like bad business to me. 
So my gyro was ready first. My husband's meatball sandwich was shortly behind. Husband opens his to find a plain flat sandwich. No cheese no marinara. It looked nothing like the picture. The cashier who later claimed to be the manager ( incase you see him there, he has a dirty facial appearance and wears two black ear plugs) told my husband he opened the sandwich and that's what he has to keep and he offered to hand him a cold slice of cheese with some marinara on the side. I reminded the "manager" again how we'd never been there before and could he make the sandwich the way my husband wanted it. He told us no and since opened it, it's a health code violation that they can't take it back. Manger became sarcastic and said this is your writing. You filled it out so I'll make you another one but you have to PAY for it!
What? What kind of customer service is this? This is a manager? 
I was now very upset at the back and forth he was giving infront of our children. I said to him he's being unreasonable and he has thee worst customer service I probably have ever seen. We said cancel the other 2 sandwiches and at this point we'll take a refund. 
I said, it would've been a better for him to eat it (meaning eat the cost) He was so ready to further argue and wouldn't stop having a negative comment to us that he twisted his wrist and flung the bag, spinning it at my husband and said, "You eat it, I'm not eating that") 
We told him how we noticed how unfriendly and miserable he was when we walked in without a greeting, only a look.
Then he proceeded to tell my husband he was a "Bad person"! 
Ooookay... we're bad people for telling you, your not doing your job? 
Again, infront of the kiddos.
We were infuriated at this point when I said what's taking you so long to return our money? 
In the end he refunds our $30 plus dollars. 
That's actually when he revealed he was the manager and when I asked for the owners information he pointed to his card and said go ahead, call him implying he could care less of what Bobby(owner) thought. As we were turning to leave he said, "Leave now or  I'm calling security." That was laughable.
We walked out with 2 apple juices and the gyro (where I threw it all away at the first trash can). 
So instead of remaking a sandwich and educating the guest,
 he returns all of our money and gives us a gyro plus 2 drinks. He lost way more than a sandwich remake. Most importantly, lost customers!
That makes zero sense.
This guy has no business in customer service. I've worked in customer service my entire life, my husband is an Executive Chef at a high end restaurant so I believe we have a more than decent amount of experience in this industry.
We did call Bobby. We'll find out if he condones this behavior soon but it'll be by the rest of you who dare enter this shop. 
If you want to be ignored, your food wait as they look at cell phone pics, and be verbally abused then this is your spot.
First impressions leave a lasting mark and customer service is everything.
Needless to say we will never go back. I would recommend anyone to choose one of the other thousands of restaurants to give your money to in Las Vegas. 
As a matter of fact maybe I'll take the employees idea, and for my next sandwich just go to Capriotti's?

They are actually pretty good, I prefer them over Subway that's for sure! There was only one girl working and she was answering personal calls from her cell phone however she was really knowledgeable about everything they offered and gave us some great suggestions so we ignored the cell phone thing.

I can't really review the food, I wasn't able to actually get any. My husband and I placed our orders - lots of different sandwich and topping selections by the way - and since the line was short they started our sandwiches immediately. Unfortunately, we weren't able to receive our order, as their system was not able to take credit cards that day. Ummm.... Maybe next time they can put a sign on the door indicating that? Or at least let the customers know prior to ordering. Some bum is going to get a couple really tasty looking club sandwiches out of the dumpster tonight. As for us, we will give them a couple weeks to work out the bugs before we try them again.

Delicious food! You customize your own sandwhich and it always comes out fantastic.  My only "complaint" is that it takes a few minutes to make them, and really it's not a complaint this isn't Subway so be prepared to have an amazing meal take a second to prepare.
they forgot my avocado! I clearly said I wanted some but they forgot and never PUT SOME. SMH I WAS LOOKING FORWARD TO MY FOOD!
Huge selection of sandwiches but they are a little on the small side, Very tasty though.  Had the french dip and added carmelized onions.  Very friendly staff.

They're milkshakes are to die for!!
I love the ability to pick anything I want. 
The kids menu is awesome too. Nothing scary for the kids. (Grilled cheese, peanut butter and jelly.....ya know, the good stuff)

Which Wich is probably one of THE BEST sandwich shops you can find on the West Coast. They have a unique ordering system where you choose a general sandwich type and grab a bag with a checklist of ingredients that you can circle or check off for the food handlers to put into your delicious sandwich.

Since I only care about taste and less about presentation, I went wild with the ingredients and practically packed my sandwich to the max. I went with the gyro sandwich and added avocados, caramelized mushrooms, and hummus in addition to the standard lettuce, tomatoes, and onions that sandwiches have.

As you can imagine, the flavor was intense and more than I could handle. This is no ordinary sandwich shop and I'm sad the location is so far away from where I live. I make the drive once every month to that shop to relive my sandwich greatest hits.

The restaurant is small, clean, and not noisy. It's family friendly and the staff is very helpful to help and accomodate you with any questions you may have about their unique ordering process.

I'd definitely defer from going to other sandwich places in the area. Which Wich is worth the 20 mile drive.

Which Wich is AMAZING, and they have a lovey menu for those who choose not to eat meat. I love the black bean patty bowl and the pumpkin pie shake is the best I've ever tasted. The people there are always nice, and I look forward to going every time.

Let me start by saying the service was exceptional!  They led us through the ordering process and asked if we wanted to add on chips/drink etc and made sure we knew of the charges.  
We ordered the Thanks Turkey - or what I like to call Thanksgiving on a sandwich.  I have ordered this at other shops - not Which Wich.  I am used to having fresh turkey on the sandwich not cold cuts.  The stuffing was hot where the rest of the sandwich was cold.  Just kinda didn't flow for me.  
My mother ordered a roast beef on wheat.  Whereas her RB was good, the bread was a bit stale.  As she stated, it tasted like it had been around for a few days.  Maybe it was an off day for the shop as well as us.  I have friends who rave about this place!
Yummy! Super nice staff. Sandwich is awesome. Better then Jimmy Johns...love the ordering process. Will definitely be back.

When it comes to small sandwich joints similar to Capriotti's, Firehouse, Subway, Port of Subs, etc. This particular place stands out. Here is why.

1. I was served immediately. 
2. The ordering style is unique.
3. My sandwich was made momentarily. 
4. The quality of food was a 9/10.
5. The price was reasonable. 
and they have a connection with Yelp (free side if you check in.)

When you walk in, to your immediate left are bags, these bags coincide with your order, meaning the styles of sandwiches have their own specific bag. On each bag is a checklist in which you cross out your choices (with a sharpie given to you) and you hand it to the cashier in which they make your sandwich accordingly. 
I only needed to wait a maximum of 3 minutes until my name was called and I was given my sandwich (an italian grinder).

The sandwich itself was packed with meat and cheese, in which was flavorful, you could taste each individual flavor within the sandwich. Thus, I give this sandwich shop five stars, their only competition is Firehouse and it certainly stands out. Will be back here for sandwiches.

They have so many options!  It's a "fresh" approach, giving you a starting point and you create your own sandwich by checking off ingredients on the bag it will go it.  Everything I have ordered here is made well and very tasty.  Tons of options, so there's something for everyone!

Employee uses their cell phones with gloves on their hands and makes sandwiches with same gloves. Dirty food, also dirty finger nails, dirty shirts, dirty sagging pants.

Nasty employees with nasty food!
Also took 30 minutes to get the sandwich with only one employee. 
This location should be closed down.

This is quickly becoming my favorite sandwich shop.

I love filling out my order on the sandwich bag and their menu is huge. They really have a lot of options even on the vegetarian menu. Hummus? Get out!

I love the design of their bags, cups and the restaurant itself. I'm a graphic designer, what can I say. I really appreciate those things.

The food is great too. I love their bread and the house chips with salt and pepper are really tasty. I love the idea of having a surf and turf sandwich, krab salad and roast beef. I tried it and it was a little bland, wish I had gotten the horseradish mayo with it. The buffalo chicken sandwich is really good, I get it with blue cheese. My friend got the Montecristo and it's probably my favorite wich so far.

I am a sandwich snob and i would say this is a above average sub sandwich. I would rate these sandwiches in a category above port of subs and jimmy johns, Subway  but below caps, pops, beach hut, earl of sandwich.

The customer service is pretty good and the meats not bad,

Just wasnt satisfied with our meal. We came in with pur kids and got the kids meals they didnt have the apple slices gave us the meal without the kids drinks we had to ask for pur kids chocolate milk. We were the only ones inside so not sure of the delay. My ruben came out soggy like really soggy to the point that i wouldnt eat it. My wifes sandwich was the philly and it was equally as bad. I dont kow what happend with this place but maybe a time for new management.
5 stars, because they let you make what you want, you rate it lower because you suck at sandwich ideas.

I was eating my wicked , as I seen the manager ask everyone how there food was doing  . I was resting my feet on a chair and he told me , that I couldn't have my feet on the chair . Then he asked me if I could eat my food at the tables outside , so a family of 4 could eat there meal. Cause I was eating at a table that sat 4. So I moved outside too finish eating my meal . After 5 mins my milk shake had melted . It's 1pm and like 105 degrees outside. So my milkshake, is melted so I pored it out in the trash and walked in too fill it up with juice . The manager approaches me again , he tells me I have too pay for the juice in my cup . So he takes my cup dumps it out and tells me too stand in line to purchase a new one . By the time I get back outside to finish my food I see that my sandwich is on the floor and there's birds picking at it .So I just left without finishing .

Now which wich knows how to make a rockin' sub!

Nothing is more delish to me than a good sandwich... 

When I walked in guess I had that confused look on my face, but the nice female clerk came right over warmly greeted me and asked if it was my first visit. She took the initiative to politely, without making me feel dumb, to explain how their place 'works' where you find your '#' or sandwich variety on the menu, select a bag, choose a marker and write down your own custom style sandwich and what you would like on it. you can select or opt out of ingredients. write in custom options and personalize with your name knowing this bag will be made for you specifically. 

Then if you check in on Yelp you'll get a free "add on" which in my case I used for extra cheese. then the gal asked if I wanted a sandwich punch card and how
Mondays are a double punch day and so on.

Overall, awesome customer service & great menu selections! This is the place if you want a really good quick lunch customized to your liking and taste.

The place has a great concept. You create your own sandwich by marking the ingredients on the paper bag you will get your food in. Pretty cool idea. However, the quality of ingredients wasn't great, but OK. The place can get busy and so expect a bit of a wait (for just a sub) 
The service is really bad! last time we took out from there, brought it home only to find out one of the sandwiches has so much mustard in it, it was inedible! Drove all the way back to the store, only to have the "dude" behind the counter give us attitude about it and argue that "he made the sandwich himself and it was perfect". (Not that he tasted it - I'd have liked to be allowed to force him to eat that mustardy sandwich himself and finish it down to the last bite!) 
Do you really think someone would drive all the way back just for a minor issue? The sandwich was inedible! Instead of apologizing for the inconvenience, he gave attitude! How rude! And to top it all off, he screwed up the replacement sandwich by forgetting one of the ingredients! We didn't drive back a second time. Sandwich was edible though it missed an ingredient. However, that was the last time we will be going to that place.

Now that TJ Max opened next door this place is no longer a secret! Longer wait times for sandwiches, and out of ice cream today for shakes. Please hire more well trained employees and stock up your supplies. The sandwiches still rock btw.

Really interesting place! I spotted this joint a while ago, since I go to the AMC theater pretty often, and decided to try it out after I got off work. I like the concept of this sandwich place, and the food was really delicious! My only thing was the people here did not seem too enthusiastic about customers coming in... But they still had about an hour left of being open. I'd understand if it was maybe 15 minutes till closing but, an hour? Really? And they weren't even trying to be secretive about it. The guy working the sandwich line was talking to his coworker (very loudly) about how customers always come in last minute and they never get to clean up on time and how they will never get to leave on time. Even as I'm writing this review he is still discussing it. I work in the food industry and I would never talk about anything like that in front of customers. It's just irritating to hear because this is your job, you should be glad that the business isn't slow. Would've been a five star review, but food is only half of what makes a restaurant good, gotta have a good attitude as well. Just my opinion though

This is a great sandwich place and a very necessary addition to the lunch choices on Rainbow and Lake Mead. 

I had my staple, turkey and cheese, but added 1000 Island dressing instead of mayo and/or mustard. It was yummy. The bread (wheat) was fresh with a slightly crunchy crust and soft inside. The turkey tasted so nice that the toddler ate most of it out of my sandwich. 

I will definitely be going back because they have egg salad that is made just with mayo. This may sound boring but, for some reason, it is difficult to find a good egg salad sandwich.

Which Wich is absolutely worth visiting if you are in the mood for a good sandwich and a pretty reasonable price. Just be prepared to change your mind about what you want as you stand in front of the menu.

Walked in and there were 2 people in front of us. They needed the menu explained so I grabbed my bag and placed my order. We had an entertainment offer thru the mobile app.  Man at the register had an attitude. Something about not his offer he would have put something better. I explained there was a buy one get one free offer but I was only getting one sandwich. It was my first time eating there and probably my last. 
I paid and waited for my sandwich to be prepared. While waiting I observed many dirty habits such as taking money and making sandwiches without changing gloves or clearly rubbing your face more than once and continuing to prepare sandwiches. 
The floor was filthy with paper and food.
It took more than 15 minutes to get our sandwich because the grumbly unhappy sandwich girl had to correct several mistakes. The highlight of the sandwich was the bread! There was very little meat and way too much pepper.  Sorry Which Wich but even with a coupon I won't waste my time or money again.

Great vegetarian or vegan option. Quick, fresh, easy, with lots of options. A scan-tron flashback to elementary school when you order. But still the food is good and fairly inexpensive. I wish there were more of these around town.
Best sandwiches.  Love the crabsalad.with all the fixings.  Always made to order and fresh sandwiches.  We do not have one by our house so my family always ask me to stop on my way home from work.

Just for 25 cents more.. This is waayyy better than subway. I love places like this where I can create my own meal. And best thing is they cook it and bring it to life. 

I've come here twice and so far everything I ordered was really delicious. I wasn't sure if I was to thank myself for creating the order or them for making it.. They have these menus with corresponding numbers to the bags you choose. Basically, you choose what meat you want and they're categorized from chicken, beef, ham and seafood. Then, you choose your toppings. Everytime I come to a sandwich spot.. I always look for two things; avacado and alpha sprouts. They had avacado but no sprouts :( but it's all good cus they have so many toppings to be just worrying about one topping.  They have their own house chips which are ruffled and seasoned with black pepper and salt. The size of these genius sandwiches are definitely filling.

I love the name itself. The staff always seems to be friendly and excited to see what people have invented. This place is an endless wonder of new things.

Unique! Is one word I would use to describe this fun restaurant.  

I just got done at LVAC which is really close to Which Wich.  As me and the gf walked in, a nice lady asked us if this was our first time here.  We said "Yes!" and she thoroughly explained how it worked.  There's brown paper bags numbered 1-10.  Whatever number 'which you want, you grab that bag, and on that bag are choices of that kind of sandwich, whatever ingredients you want, what kind of bread, sauces, etc.  They provide you with a red sharpie to 'x' mark the ingredients you want. At this point me and the gf are having fun just marking a brown paper bag! 

When your order is placed, they attach your marked brown paper bag to a clothes line so they can easily see what you want on your 'which.  We didn't get our food lighting fast but what good food is fast? None! Everything tasted just how I wanted it, the brown paper bag and sharpie idea is genius!  The sandwich was so good, I forgot about my house chips. (salt and peppered kettle chips) Which are hella good, simple too.

This was my first time here and I ordered their signature sandwich, The Wicked.  My first time experience was eye-opening to all these other whack sandwich shops.  I'm definitely gonna be coming back here and becoming a regular.

PS. Bathrooms are clean!

This was my first time there and I ordered of French dip sandwich with sautéed onions and a vanilla shake. The lady at the register was very helpful since it was my first time visiting this restaurant. The quality of the food seem very high and lots of people were inside eating . I will definitely try this place again and look forward to trying many other sandwiches.

On top of the amazing freaking sandwich I so wonderfully blue printed, big black homie who made my sandwich went salt bae on it and delivered a Gordon Ramsay-esque roast beef sandwich. That sandwich was good as heck. If I had another $6.50, I would've gotten another one. My stupid self checked roast beef instead of French dip and he so kindly gave me a little Au Jus. I swear I was at Disneyland with this type of magical customer service. Kudos big homie.

What can I say? I am a whore for Which Wich. I know in reality its a run of the mill sandwich place but they have so many little features that speak to me it catapults ahead of almost any other place. 

1. Milkshakes. More sandwich places should have milkshakes. More any place should have milkshakes. Not only do they have milkshakes, but their milkshakes are awesome as can be seen by all the boy sin the yard. Milkshake
2. Pellet ice. For those of you who aren't ice conniseurs like me, pellet ice is the little sphere shaped ice pieces as opposed to large chunks. The increase in surface area makes drinks cool faster and the ice better to chew. It also creates a sort of archipelago  of icy cold deliciousness on the top of a soda and makes it fizz more. Pellet ice is the pinnacle of human evolution. 
3. Skinny- nothing ruins a fine sandwich like too much bread. The skinny at which wich turns those preposterous french rolls into little more than a thin crispy exoskeleton of bread leaving plenty of room to stuff with delicious meats and cheeses without making the sandwich explode

4. Ordering is quick and efficient. Sure, 1 out of 3 people in the door have no idea what is going on, but that just means you can cut in line in front of them -if they can't protect their space in line then it would be unAmerican not to.

5. Online app- all my orders have been ready on time for pickup, more than can be said for other so called sandwich places

6. Consistency - anyone who has ever been to a subway knows that how good your sandwich is will be a product of the individual sandwich artist. Some of them paint like picaso, others turn your order into a Jackson Pollack. Which Wich may not have the artistry but consistency more than makes up for it.

Not my first pick for a sandwich chain, but gotta give them props for their multitude of customization options: where else can you get grilled onions, sliced egg, and pesto on your sandwich without anyone batting an eye?

Downsides: the ordering process isn't clearly outlined on signage at the door, so there's a backup if there are more than 3 customers in the store who don't know what they're doing. This is all locations I've been to though, not this one specifically.

Appreciate that orders are written down to ensure accuracy, but the system still relies on employees filling the orders and they're prone to human error- like forgetting the sliced egg I paid extra for and randomly tossing on jalapenos, when the olive salad is already a bit spicy.

The caprese option on the menu is a welcome addition, but the cheese is of low quality and this location didn't have balsamic, so it didn't hit the spot.
Italian option is solid, as are their Philly sandwiches, but I usually customize something ridiculous- free premium topping with check in, word!

like most people..this is above subway and port of subs,  its  close to my house so
I use it as a go to "i don't wanna cook tonight place'.   my oldest son always gets the 14 inch Wicked..with everything except olives..it is a monster of a sandwich that should easily feed four, but he eats it all by himself.  All in all we have been here numerous times and my kids never complain so they are alright in my book, plus the shakes are darn good.

I am diagnosing Which Wich with sandwich shop schizophrenia.  One moment you'll think it's the greatest thing in sandwich history and the next moment you'll wonder why it tastes so bland.

Let's break it down this way:
- Meat toppings: delicious, fresh.  Specifically the roast beef and the buffalo chicken.  Simply brilliant.

- Cheese toppings: spot on.  Well done Which Wich!  Specifically, the sharp cheddar (delicious) and the blue cheese (real blue cheese, not blue cheese dressing).

- Veggie toppings: crisp and fresh with real flavor.

- Bread: . . . Alright, Which Wich, let's talk.  You could be the greatest sandwich shop in the world, but your bread is tasteless and uninteresting.  It has ruined more than one sub for me before.  Sometimes I take the filling out of the sub and eat it alone because the bread is so bad.  I've taken to getting the bread toasted to try to hide the lack of flavor.

On the contents of its subs, Which Wich is a sandwich god.  But add in the awful bread and Which Wich ranks behind Capriotti's (which is in a different league from all sub shops) and right behind Jimmy John's.
Things have improved.  Food is still good.  The cashier didn't know about yelp check in offers, but one of the sandwich makers did.

In the peak of 2010's winter solstice, in a land of magical spectacles and bright lights called Las Vegas, Nevada, Yelpers were caught in a weird storm of strange weather and rain that no one really expects in this part of the world.  Rain was as rare as Mr. T wearing silver.  Not only was this storm rare and unusual, but there was a different storm hitting Las Vegas that none knew what to expect from.  The mystical appearances caused a disturbance to find the 'Wich that had it all.  And thus, cause the hunt for the best 'Wich in town!

Which Wich is in the race for the best sandwich shop in Las Vegas!  It's unique menu and ordering methods refresh the Vegas valley with a new taste and flavor that makes ordering sandwiches a definite memorable experience.  As seen in some earlier reviews, you order your 'Wich by choosing one or more bags from the wall of bags.  Different bags correspond what kind of meat comes on the sandwich.  Markers are conveniently located nearby to mark off different toppings, sauces, cheeses, peppers, etc. Go to the cashier, pay for your 'Wich and sit tight because you're moments from enjoying something different!

My GF and I ordered the Wicked (5 MEATS!: Turkey, Bacon, Roast Beef, Ham, and Pepperoni and 3 CHEESES!: Provolone, Cheez Whiz, Pepperjack [choices of Cheddar and Swiss also]) and I'll testify to it's wickedness! It was a bit overwhelming for my GF the way we threw everything on there (see pictures for sandwich details) but for me, it was a medley of all-star tastes! "Less is more!" says my GF, Dana Marie Dabu (reviews to come soon but soon to never come!). Try out our combo and let me know what you think! However, the Oreo cookie shake is LEGIT! Add it to your combo for just a few more dollars! You won't be sorry you did. They also have Hershey's Chocolate, and Banana! And, on your way to the restroom, check out the cool customer art section of the walls! I'll have to add my doodles here next time!

I will definitely have to come back to try the rest of their great menu with so much to choose from. Oh, and if you like A1 like I do, they have it! :D

Ok, I admit that I wasn't excited about this place to begin with. I figured it was just another sandwich shop,  but my boss gave us gift cards for xmas, so I  decoded to try it out. 
Great Zeus' ghost was I wrong! Everything from the cool ordering process (that ensures you get just what you want & nothing you don't), the helpful staff  (who always ask if it's your first time so that you know what the heck is going on), the fresh ingredients & the heaping portions are awesome. Sure, it's a little expensive for a sandwich, but it's darn well worth it! 
I've already been twice and will continue to go back. YOU are a darn fool of you don't give this a try. I'd post a pic but there's nothing left of my Cuban with Swiss, added bacon & dijon mustard. I gobbled that beast up faster than you can say "Subway doesn't hold a candle! "
So here's the empty wrapper and the brownie that i'm about to dive headfirst into!
Many options to choose from. You build it how you want it. They even pull out the extra bread from the center, leaving a flaky outer layer. Great sandwich shop!

All i can say is Yummm 
My sandwich spot used to be firehouse (firehouse who?) lol.
You create your own sandwich and the way you do it is really cute when you arrive there are brown bags you just got to select your protein and it guides you on what number bag you need to get and you write your name and select all the ingredients you want once you're done filling it out, you place your baggy at the counter where they start preparing your which. If you don't want a sandwich you have the option of doing a spinach wrap or even a salad which I think is amazing.

Way better than I remembered when I first had Which Wich in Fullerton. Over there, they were so skimpy with the meat. Here, both our sandwiches were packed full. The Wicked was the best, with five meats and three cheeses. Also you can add on many different extras and sauces for free, plus some with an upcharge. Horseradish mayo has a nice kick, as does the hot pepper mix. If you get a salty sandwich, adding in cole slaw is a good choice. Wheat bread kinda had a slightly stale texture, so if you want soft airy bread, stick with the white.

Staff was very friendly and as we walked in asked if we had been there before. If not they would help you place your order.

Sign up for their birthday club and get a free sandwich for your birthday! Also on Weds the Wicked is only $5 for a small!
Always a great sandwich. Way better then any other sub place. This place actually tastes fresh.

Which Wich's  baguette bread is the biz- even better nicely toasted!

I keep coming in for the same crab salad wich but i always change up the sauces, just for experimenting, until I find the cream of' combo.That's what I like about their order swag. Dotting in my own personal votes for building my wich just like at a poll booth during election day; or like Yelp's review rating polls.

I can't believe these folks have tzatziki sauce! Awesome. But they don't have spinach and/or sprouts. I feel indifferent for pointing that out but that's what makes a good gourmet sandwich(to me) plus its nutritional value.

This place is far from a 5 star rating- only because their customer service connection is disconnected. Every visit is like a miserable Monday for them. I saw the cash reg' chick watch a guy come in and was about to greet him but then bailed. Awkward that I had to witness that. And then a group of people came in and monotonously said "welcome to Which Wich" 

My "adhd" had me imagining how cute it'd be if an r2d2 were to greet me in a robotic voice. Cute right? 

Anyways, the truth is, I'd enjoy this place more if they marched to the beat of a happier drum. Perhaps it's the semi-emo indie music playing above that's altering their aura.

I used to LOVE Which Wich but the last three times that I went there, there sandwiches are disgusting. How are they disgusting? They smear all the mustard all over the sandwich on the bread, it's NEVER in the middle of the sandwich. It's always on the bread where it's all soggy even when I asked them to not do that.

Usually the workers are very snobby and they act like you are a pain for asking something so reasonable.

Which 'wich indeed, so many choices! Some of my favorites are the black bean patty, and the turkey. I love that you can get a lettuce wrap, and the website has a full list of nutritional information. 

The staff is friendly and they have a rewards program, which I can't tell you about because I never remember to register my card, and always end up losing it and starting over. It's gets busy around lunch time, but there are a few tables outside that are almost always open. 

They have a seltzer option on their soda machine (which for some reason not all places offer) so I always get a large plastic cup....I have quite the classy collection of them now, lol. It's a convenient location, I usually stop by here for a quick lunch if I've been at the Lake Mead/Rainbow LVAC, or more likely scenario, doing some shopping at the Best in the West Plaza. 

Stop by Rita's Italian Ice next door for dessert!

The food is amazing. The inside seems to always be dirty! I have to clean off the table before I eat! And the floor always has food on it. The front blind is still broken! Management needs to step up and hold the teenage staff accountable.

An absolute must try on any local's sandwich list. If you are a fan of the Potbelly chain of sandwich shops in the Midwest, East Coast and Texas, you will love Which Wich. (Potbelly one-ups Which Wich by offering a 'thin-cut' option on the wheat bread loaf - cutting out the inside bread leaving only the crust - but that is a fine point.)

The secret ingredient here is the hot pepper mix, which is right out of the Potbelly arsenal. I swear it's the same recipe. You have to try it. It throws your sandwich into a new dimension that the Earl Of Sandwich can't even comprehend. I happen to love the seafood mix which is imitation crab (pollock) and perfectly dressed. Sometimes I get the Surf & Turf which is any meat plus crab (no extra charge). There is also no extra charge for typical 'extra' items like cheese, guacamole, hummus, etc. One price, no surprises. Which Wich gives you Freedom Of Sandwich. The sandwich toaster here runs a perfect medium, unlike the toasters at Quizno's and Firehouse Subs which tend to burn your loaves.

Easy to get to: take 95N to the Lake Mead East / Rainbow North exit, and take Rainbow North right into the parking lot. 

I sound obsessed, but I must stand up for a great sandwich. And this store is consistently good and their service is always friendly and top notch. Get the hot pepper mix on the side if you're scared, just don't forget to get some.

The biggest sandwich here is worth every penny if you're starving. So big it sticks out of the bag 4 or 5 inches. Which Wich? THIS Wich All Day Long.

My favorite fast-food sandwich in Las Vegas by far. (If there were a Potbelly here I would be less convinced. But there's not, so Which Wich it is!)
Absolutely love this place. Could eat here every single day! Can be a little pricey but it is definitely worth it. Better than most sandwich shops in the area.

Got dinner here last night (8:15 pm) and the two guys working gave A+ service!!!! Sandwiches are as good as it gets! 
Thanks guys, we have a new favorite sammy shop!

Which Wich is an awesome sandwich shop! I love their approach. It is fun and tasty. The sandwiches are fresh and unique compared to what else is offered today. 

When you first walk in you are greeted by the friendly staff of the location. You then make your way to the board to order. You will grab a novelty brown paper bag and fill out what you would like on your sandwich, its a bubble in bag with fun red sharpie, it could be relaxing if there weren't so many great options. This is GREAT. This ensure that you get exactly what you want. You are not having to repeatedly tell a worker over the glass what you want or reach your nasty little fingers over the barrier to rudely gesture at the vegetables that you need to decorate you sandwich with. This helps keep things sanitary because guess what, the employees know the locations of the veggies and do not need your crusty old fingers over the glass waving around all the fixins' (I AM LOOKING AT YOU PATRONS OF SUBWAY AND CHIPOTLE). 

You then present your order to the cashier who confirms what you want and you ask for the large cup, yes large. This gets you a reusable plastic cup that now litters your cabinets in droves. You do not even bother with regular glasses anymore, this is just better. You are being green and enjoying 32oz of water at a time.  

You take a seat, check your email and try to look important for a bit. They call your name and you receive your glorious custom made sandwich with all accoutrements that you could muster to put on the 10.5 inch sub. 

After enjoying said sandwich you make your way to the cashier once again for dessert. Oh yes. You order the peanut butter cookie which is absolutely flawless. However, you decide that today you are gunna "treat yo self" and order the ice cream cookie sandwich. Your sugar level sky rockets and you pass out in your car in a food coma until the proper help arrives and you return to your normal work day filled with regret and sadness that you have to wait until tomorrow to repeat this venture.

Despite the reviews, the sandwiches were not good at all. The meat tasted per packaged and as if it were turning.  Their ordering system is clunky and confusing.  Unfortunately, I can not recommend this place.

Tried Which Wich today for the first time and was able to use my coupon (free reg sub w/purchase of chips and drink) which I received after signing up for their email/online offers. The sandwich itself deserves 5 stars, however, I'm docking one due to the poor customer service. Maybe these guys were just tired from working the lunch rush, maybe they've had a long day, but in my experience, nothing excuses poor customer service (please also keep in mind, I've too had a long day but was still able to thank you and smile). I've read about their stamp card, but wouldn't know anything else about it since it wasn't offered (and I just remembered as I logged back unto Yelp) :( Maybe next time.

We had lunch here a couple of months ago. 

Which wich has an interesting ordering process where you pick one of numerous sandwich types and customize your wich through marking your cheese, spread, and topping selections on your bag. 

I had an avocado and tomato wich. My wife had a chicken philly and a chocolate and banana shake. 

The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. We also split some homemade chips which were unique and tasty.
I love this place....always delicious and fresh and just the way I order it. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Diana is a sweetheart.
Sandwiches are great, you'd be hard pressed to find a place that has more toppings, and most places in Vegas don't have giardineira. Downside is that they take a long time to make a sandwich.

Went across town from Henderson just to get some Which Wich. Wish they had this excellent place on the GVR side of town. The food was delicious and the service was great. I don't know his name but the guy who took care of us was awesome, management should give him some kudos, we went on 8/3 at 11 a.m.

If you want a good sub or grinder stop by this place.
I love this place. If your looking for a great traditional east coast style hoagie or sandwich stop on by. I'm from NJ and think it ranks with my favorite spots in NJ.

I think I might be beyond disappointed in my meal. I ordered online where there is very little room for error given that each detail is in PRINT. I absolutely HATE olives, banana peppers, lettuce etc. I get my sandwich and it literally has whatever they chose to throw on there. I even added a tip while ordering online. Pissed! I had someone pick up my order for me who didn't check it before and now they are closed. I have my order receipt which is furthest from the sandwich I was given. There was another sandwich on my order which had some of those toppings listed but of course it's so jumbled she's equally disappointed. Her order should of had lettuce but has cucumbers. Should of had banana peppers but I have those...she got my mustard though. Really?

I LOVE this place. My friend brought me and was telling me it was the "best subs ever" I didn't believe her.. Then I created my own sub. It was GLORIOUS. I had there house chips and they were so good too. Perfect experience honestly. The only downfall of this place is they don't have one in Henderson !! But best believe I'll be making the drive to eat here again.
I wish they would open more of these in town. Awesome selection of subs. Love how you order by yourself with the marker and brown bag, come to Henderson please!

My first time here I was just standing there staring at the wall. Even though the guys behind the counter explained everything to me, I still had to take a couple minutes just to decide what I wanted.

Finally I decided to go with the original Philly, which was the #8 bag. Apparently this was their designated product development bag in which they come up with experimental sandwiches. The other bags are other things like chicken, pork, beef, etc.

So you grab a designated numbered bag, check off all your choices on that bag whether its extra or nothing of something. Lastly, don't forget to put your name before you hand it off to the guys behind the counter. Pay and then wait. They put the bags up on a clothes line while they make it. Nice concept. They read what you checked off so there is no mistake. As soon as its done, they put it in your bag and call your name.

Back to my Philly. It was decent. Two things though. It was kind of small with only the one size choice (7 inches) and thought it need some kind of sauce. I asked the guys if they had anything spicy to put in my sandwich. They gave me a small cup of spicy ranch sauce which I should of had them put in my sandwich in the first place.

Overall, I had a good experience. I just thought the sandwich was a bit small. I think next time I will get the "The Wicked" sandwich. Based on the pic, it does look pretty wicked with all the different meats up in there.

Yelp 2014 Review Challenge #38

Our experience between the two times we have been so far was inconsistent. The first time we were greeted and asked if we needed any help, zero personality the second time we went. Their ordering system is really quite clever but the execution needs some work. The person  working the blender for the milkshakes may have been in training but oooh, they were slow. I'm also not a fan of food arriving in stages. I'd like to be able to eat my sandwich, chips and drink at the same time and dessert should come after. Nope, I got my cookie first, my sandwich second and my shake last. Shouldn't it be the other way around?

Now as far as the food goes. No complaints there. I really like the crusty bread, and there are a zillion ways to customize you sandwich, there are even some selections that are not traditional. I like the fact that they have several selections per category, so that if you are sort of wishy washy you have a "base" to build your sandwich selection on. They are well put together and I did not have to rearrange the fillings to have maximum flavor coverage as I so often have to do in other establishments. If at the very least every time I drop by Borders I might stop in for a delicious chocolate chip cookie or milkshake.

All in all, a little expensive, food is yummy, service needs a lot of work.
Lots of choices and fresh ingredients. I dont think you can go wrong if you make your own sandwich

Since "discovering" Which Wich? in Albuquerque in 2010, I got my husband hooked in Carlsbad later that year.  And since then, we've been stopping at this Which Wich at least once per visit to his mom's house, not too far from here.  Yes, much like our previously-well-documented-on-Yelp love for Jimmy John's, we actually seek out this sandwich chain, since the nearest one to us is about 35 miles away in a part of SoCal we seldom visit.  And, like JJ, I've eaten WW in three different states.  Sad but true!
So it should be clear from this that we love the concept of Which Wich.  I'll leave that to others to describe.  But what I want to give a shout out to with this store is their really friendly nice staff.  Every single time we've been in, they've been fast, friendly, and make great sandwiches.  Last time we were in, as my last meal before running the Vegas marathon, they were extra friendly and chatty and we had a nice talk while we ate with one of the staffers, who was stamping the bags during slow periods, about running and how crazy marathons seemed.  (Although I was running it, I definitely was agreeing with her.)  I felt special, being wished good luck by a lady who just happened to be ringing me up for my sandwich!  Big props to WW for their friendly service!

Excellent customer service!!!!! Best sandwich I've had in Vegas hands down! Cute concept & Jose was so polite, friendly, & helpful! Only wish it was closer to my side of town! The bread was fresh and perfectly toasted after I ordered mine hot. I love all the spread & sauce options! I got the olive spread, & it definitely is what made my sandwich!!

Saw this while apartment hunting. It's a very nice sandwich shop. Clean and organized. The ordering process is unique.  One must take a bag and fill out the order yourself which is great cause you can't really get it wrong. I ordered the corned beef with deli mustard and  swiss cheese. The bread is so fresh and they grill it to a crisp perfection. The meat was super tender but kinda flavorless. It tasted more like roast beef instead of corned beef. The middle was cold and I asked for it to be hot. Still the sandwich was perfectly made and tasted scrumptious. The mustard was proportioned well and not overdone.  Perfect balance. I recommend this place most definitly.

When it comes to franchise sandwich shops in Vegas on a scale from Subway to Capriotti's, I would place Which Wich somewhere closer towards the latter.  As the name implies, this is either a nightmare for the indecisive or a dream for those who crave variety and customization.

Upon walking in, the lady behind the counter was kind enough to ask if I was a W squared newbie or knew how to place my order.  She then directed me to consult the list posted on the wall which indicated several templates for various sandwiches in the form of brown paper bags with a list of items to check off.  From classics (italian, turkey, ham) to the gourmet (surf and turf, buffalo chicken avocado) to the international (cuban, greek, huevos rancheros (what the what?!)) and the truly bizarre (Elvis and Monte Cristo)...you take your red sharpie pen and indicate whether you want your bread toasted in the form of white, wheat, or served in a bowl with croutons, a redonkulous number of toppings, cheeses, and sauces (notables including pesto, fried shoestring onions, sauerkraut, cheese whiz, and hot pepper mix) and then hand it over to the cashier and your sandwich order then arrives within the same brown paper bag ready to nosh.  This is pretty much like a mad scientist sandwich lab for someone trying to craft the world's perfect sandwich...wichcraft one might say!
I also recommend getting their tasty homemade chips seasoned with salt/pepper as a side and I believe there is a nice 10% discount on a combo for first timers if you check in on yelp.   Bonus points for having options for house-made milkshakes and fresh baked cookies!

How have I not reviewed this place yet?  OMG, this place is beyond amazing.  Subway who?

Pros:
*  Everything I've tried here is bursting with flavor!  I have yet to discover a bad 'wich.
*  home made chips.  Jared doesn't have that.  Nor does Quizno's.
*  a plethora of toppings/additions available (from Pesto to crispy onion strings).

Cons:
*  It's a bit more pricey in comparison to Subway, but well worth the price.  Honest!
*  seating is a bit limited.  There are outside seats, but it still gets super crowded.
*  service isn't stellar, but whatever.

Overall:
  I highly recommend this place for those that love sandwiches.  Really, you've just gotta try it for yourself.  If you have never been... here's a little heads up:  
Choose your bag and grab a crayon.  Bubble in your choices and viola!  After making your selections and choosing whether you want to make it a combo, watch the sandwich artists clothespin your 'wich bag to a wire and zip-line that baby.  Not making any sense?  Just go in and check it out.  You'll see. 

Tips:
*  Pesto is a must.  
*  Carb-Watching?  You can get any sandwich in a bowl instead.
*  my personal recommendation is the Surf n Turf.  it's roast beef w/ imitation crab.
I waited 17 minutes for my rueben,  and no one was in front of me.  My rueben had No sauerkraut,  and No thousand island on it!  How is that even a rueben! !!!!

We stopped by this after going to the as they grow sale. A soccer team showed up right before us. The place was packed. These guys were pumping out the sandwiches pretty fast. We are never on this side of town so we checked it out.  It was pretty good.  I got the buffalo chicken sandwich.  I even got a free cookie for checking in.  I wish they had one of these in my neck of woods.  I wouldn't seek this place out, but if  you are in the area it is a must try! Cheers!

High class subway, delish, but not over the top.  Value is here, taste is here, great quick on the go lunch.  Its build your own, which sometimes, I dont like, I just want you to build me the bomb, and I will eat it, if I gotta make choices, thats too complicated.  You can do both, I guess, but I prefer less than 10 questions when I order lunch.   That said, it was incredible!   Loved it!    Would definitely go again and order my own creation!   For creators, this is your subway stop!  Recommended!  Cheap and good food!   Yummy rating is high!

I love the sandwiches here and the concept of "building" your own on the paper bags is fun and unique.  I happened upon Which Wich while working down in Rancho Sante Fe, CA...we ended up eating there for lunch nearly every day.  Then while on a project in Dallas we found one located in the mall...BAM, nearly every lunch was had there too!  The milkshakes are outstanding too...they actually use real ice cream and Hershey's chocolate syrup.  Forget about the chips in the bag from Vicky whoever it is...it's all about the house chips in the brown bag here; get two (they are small and you'll have them gone before your sub arrives).

Too bad there is only one in Vegas...and it is in the most inconvenient area of town for me based on my home and work sites. Oh well...worth the trip here and there.

I also noticed a Rita's Italian Ice is going in next door...that's another reason to force me out of my comfort zone and travel out to Rainbow/95.

This place is great! I've never been inside a sandwich place like this before. 

So what's different than other places? They have a variety of sandwiches and salads to choose from, and you can pick which one you would like all from a BAG. You find the bag that matches the meal you want and pick what you'd like on/it by marking it on the bag with a fun colorful marker. It's different and fun! 

The staff was extremely helpful and kind! 

The sandwich I ordered was awesome! There are other ones I would like to try sometime. Try it out, you shouldn't be disappointed. #delicious

This was the 1st time I went here and loved it!! I'm from Chicago and love this some place called Potbellys and this place tastes a lot like it. 
Customer service was GREAT and the food was GREAT!!! Will be coming back for sure!
Every time I come here, my sandwich is made correctly, the people are friendly and I leave satisfied. Thank you!

Which wich, why oh why do you only have one location when I could eat so much more of you if you were closer? 
Also, why did it take so many sandwich shops to finally come up with this FREAKIN" AMAZING concept? 
You choose your bag via your choice of meat; turkey, ham, chicken, roast beef etc. Then write down or check off every single thing you want on it! Want balsamic? No problem! How about olive spread? They have that too. Honey mustard AND spicy mustard, YUP- they can pull it off! 
They also always have a special, most recent was the pastrami. Do yourself a favor and get the VOODOO chips. They taste like barbecue met up with jalapeno and had a salt and vinegar baby. 
Real ice cream shakes, and hot cookies. Do I need to even keep typing? Why are you not there yet? Or at least bookmarking it on Yelp!
They have punch cards, with double punch Mondays. Not once have I had to wait long, or experience anything other than stellar service. My only complaint is the one location, far far away. But it's worth the drive, so they will continue to get my business.

Upgrading Which Wich to a 5. They have continued to deliver delicious, well-crafted sandwiches, and the employees are always very hardworking and helpful, providing suggestions and personal input when desired. Their food is always fresh and well-portioned. The expanding selection of sandwich options is sure to please any craving. Also, their milkshakes are exceptional! One of the best banana malts I've had. Keep up the good work!

As I sit here, sandwich done, I am currently waiting on a milkshake that has gone unnoticed on their clothespin line they use to slide orders down on. Their system involves paper bags customers mark with their order, each type of sandwich having their own bag and toppings. Each sandwich type is numbered and the bag holders are numbered accordingly. We used the suspend and ordered two combos totaling 18 bucks. Damn. 

The staff looks flustered, almost as if training was thrown out the window and the manager figured that they'd figure it all out on their own. Subway has a better system and that's saying something. We waited and our names were called out for our orders. 

The sandwiches are in subway type rolls, wrapped in those old fashioned silver hamburger papers and parchment with their logo. They come warm, which is fine. The bread is good but the meat and toppings are just okay. In all honesty I was shocked that my sandwich only had two large slices of turkey sandwich meat. Weird. I chose the cranberry and stuffing version, one I learned to love from another sandwich store. It was okay. The BLT comes with crumbled bacon, although strange it tasted like a BLT. 

Overall, I think because they're new the kinks are still being worked out. I hope that when I return in 6 months the food and service improved.

Really fun sandwich place!  U can really create what ever your craving cough* cough* Elvis Wich I love you!! They also have healthy lettuce wrap version of all sandwiches and alot of vegetarian options 

Only wish the staff was more helpful because the ordering process can be confusing on your first visit. 

Also they have been out of main ingredients on several of my visits..... no bueno

During my last visit here, I came around the closing hour (8:30-ish) so I didn't expect a lot of people to be here, or for the staff to even be enthusiastic. 

I ordered the Pepperoni Pizzawich (Pepperoni, Mozzarella, Parmesan) with caramelized onions, mushrooms, garlic, salt, and pepper on a toasted wheat bun. It was pretty good and tasted like I expected. The only downside to this dining experience was that I ordered a hot sandwich but the pepperoni was a little cold in the center. Despite this, my experience here was still pretty good. I will definitely come back again.

We found this place on yelp and came in because of its concept. Bobby helped us get started.  Explained how everything works, he was extremely  friendly. One of the best customer service we had all week. 

Basically you pick a number or the type of sandwich you like then choose a bag corresponding to that sandwich. you fill out the the bag with a red sharpie , all the ingredients  you wish to put on the sandwich. There's even a  spot to put your name.  It was really neat! 

My wife got the med (10.5 inches) Club.  It has ham ,turkey and bacon she added avocado with provolone , red onions,  lettuce, cucumbers , jalapeños , on a white roll (oil, salt &pepper ) the club was $ 8.50 plus $1.50 for avocado.  

While waiting my wife orders an ice cream sandwich chocolate chip on both sides and vanilla ice cream . It was made fresh, really big & extremely delicious.  It was $ 3.50 and worth every penny. 

I ordered the med size Grinder, it had salami , pepperoni & Capitola with provolone, lettuce , tomatoes, banana peppers & cucumbers  on a white roll (mayo,mustard , oil, vinegar , salt &papper) the grinder was $8.50 

The food was good, the customer service was great.  No complaints

I went here because it was easy and I had hoped fast while I was on my lunch break. I was the only customer there so thought I would be in and out. I placed my order and listened to the three workers there complain and gossip about their coworkers, one even said someone needed to work on their customer service. What's funny about that statement is that I watched the person who was supposed to be making my food stand and talk to his coworkers for about 7 minutes. I spent more time staring at him chit chatting then it did to make my simple sandwich. The sandwich was overpriced imo and I could've got a bigger one for less at subway that would've tasted the same. Really disappointed with this experience and wouldn't go back or recommend it to anyone.
Subway needs to watch its back. Comparable prices, better quality, and outstanding selection put Which Wich ahead of the game. And might I recommend the Wicked?

There are various sandwiches to pick from, but I like "The Wicked" the best.

It comes with FIVE meats! Turkey, Ham, Roast Beef, Pepperoni and Bacon!  You can also get extra meat/bacon for an additional charge.

I picked the small sandwich (white bread).  You can choose if you want your sandwich cold or hot.  I picked hot.  And size small, which is still seven inches, so it's not THAT small.

Anyone ordering can also make it a hot sandwich or a cold one.  I find that very convenient due to the Las Vegas weather (being in the desert, super hot, then super cold....).

"The Wicked" also comes with three cheeses!  My favorites are Cheddar, Pepper Jack and I should have tried Cheez Whiz (but probably nothing like Pat's Cheesesteaks in Philly) so I decided to skip it.  I should have at least tried, there's always next time....

You are allowed to choose sauces and spreads.  I thought a Mediterranean twist would taste great.  So I chose Pesto and Olive Salad.  I skipped the various mustard selection and went straight for the horseradish mayo.  I also added crispy onion strings, and it gave the sandwich a nice little crunch.

So sort of sticking with my "sort of" Mediterranean sandwich, I also added spinach, tomatoes, bell peppers and mushrooms. 

I wish that I had put oil and vinegar, I was in a hurry and forgot.  Bur regardless, "The Wicked" sandwich is tasty and will fill you up.  I bought a small one and it was quite filling.

Since you pick out your own bag for what sandwich you want, anyone can get what they want.  Wonderful, right?  And YUMMY!!!

The employees are phenomenal here! This was my first time here and the cashier explained everything and she was so nice. The guy making the sandwiches even chimed in. I would literally just come here for the service but my sandwich was sooooo good. Buffalo chicken sandwich.. try it, thank me later.

Using a restaurant.com certificate, spend $20, get $10 off.  Located in a squeezed in shopping area.  Interesting concept on how to order, took me a while to figure it out.  I went for the med. crab sandwich, hubby tried the Philly cheese special.  The gal who took our order was very patient and helped us try and meet our $20 max.  We ordered a milkshake only to be told they'd run out off ice cream.  Great.  We thought we'd added a soda, but with the disappointment of no shake we added extra meat to the Philly and a bag of chips, reaching a total of $20 even. I wasn't sure what to add to mine, so I went minimal: mayo, salt/pepper, red onions.  On the bag for the Philly, it stated cheese whiz, caramelized onions in parentheses, so you'd think this was standard.  Not!  Since we didn't mark these specifics, none of these were added to the sandwich!  Not even the mushrooms we DID MARK on the bag were present, though they did add the extra meat. Philly cheese with no cheese?  Their breads are long, so you think you're getting this huge sandwich, but they're narrow, so don't envision a fatty like from Togo's.  Don't think we'll be back as hubby was VERY disappointed.  Good thing we only spent $10.

This is my favorite sandwich shop in Vegas. Only problem is it's a 30 min drive to get there. The Wicked is ridiculously good and there's a large selection of toppings and dressings that you can add free.

Let me start by saying, I LOVE sandwiches. If I don't feel like cooking dinner, a sandwich will always fill the void.

The sandwiches here were not really a step above what I could do at home, they are more akin to Subway quality than Earl of Sandwich.

Prices-Meh Quality-Meh Overall-Meh

Sunday sandwich improv artists... Running low on supplies today(busy saturday...just goes to show you how legit this place is) had to make some substitutions but with so many options, you are bound to create a masterpiece even if you dont intend to. Thanks Allison!, Thanks Alec & Val you rock! Always great service and great wiches. Keep it up.

I have been curious about Which Wich for a while and actually tried it today.  I've been to places where you write down all the goods and hand your paper to them, but somehow writing on a bag it makes it so much better.  :)  The staff was friendly (maybe too...) and sandwich was delicious!

Me and my wife went and checked this sandwich shop out the other night. I had the cheese steak and my wife had thier version of the holidays Turkey sandwich. The food was very mediocre at best. We had a few bites the decided to go to capriottis. I would put this sandwich shop in the bottom with all of the fast food sandwich shops. If your looking for signature sandwiches that set themselves apart from the rest of the pack this not the sandwich shop for you.

Tasty sandwich with lots of add-on's available, however the ordering system is bizarre.  I did like that I could choose healthy add-on's, such as spinach, mushroom and onion.  I also like that you have a choice of having your sandwich served hot or cold.  The location itself is really small and on a 100+ degree day, it was tough to get a seat for 2 people.  We'll be back!

I wish Which Wich was close to my house, because it is one of my favorite sandwich places in Vegas. My kids love going there and filling out their orders on their own sandwich bags. Everything I have ever had at WhichWich has been delicious. Great, fresh bread, meats and fixins. Highly recommend!

the staff was friendly and helpful since it was my first time there. i like the concept and complete customization. i got the pesto chicken on wheat with veggies and avocado. yummm. the price isnt bad either!

Cool concept but a tad bit overwhelming! The issue I have with which wich is too many dang options.

I wanted a turkey sandwich and accidentally picked the wrong bag and ended up with some 5 meat concoction. (Unfortunately, I didn't check before leaving so I had to roll with it.)

Overall this is an average sandwich spot but I think I would prefer Port of Subs over Which Wich.

It is pretty rare that an overall Yelp rating is actually spot on for a restaurant but this place is a definite rarity in itself.

The ordering system is a bit confusing for a Which Wich virgin but once you get the hang out it it all makes sense. Sadly, the customer service aspect has been taken out of the equation because of the ordering which makes it seem a bit robotic.

The option to have combos with a milkshake is a pretty cool touch and my buddy said his banana/chocolate milkshake was delicious. Any place where you can customize your options to your exact specifications makes me happy in the pants. 3.5 stars for you Which Wich. Your name on the other hand.....10 stars!

This was my first time to this shop.  I pride myself being somewhat of a sandwich connoisseur so I was excited to try this place out.  I enjoyed being able to write what I would like on the sandwich bag. I was a little disappointed that the gyro was unavailable. 

We put in our order and waited.  While we were waiting the staff proceeded to talk with their friends who were just hanging out in the store.  The friends were in the food area when he was making our food and running around chasing one of the girls who worked there.  We ended up waiting around 15-20 minutes for our sandwiches and we were the only customers in the store.  It just seems like a poorly managed establishment.  I felt really uncomfortable being in there.

The food was ok.  Nothing compared to Capriottis.
Totally yummy food. Better than Subway or Quiznos. Reminds me of a place I used to love in DC called "Pot Belly Sandwich Works"

UPDATE: I give it an A-OK for effort. I got a message from a Manager sincerely apologetic for my experience. I was offered a free sub and I figure the least I can do is give it a 4th try since the Manager made the effort.
I do appreciate that.
I will take a friend that hasn't been to Which Wich before and then we can both give it an honest review again.
Wish us luck!

The sandwiches are phenomenal, but the service was terrible, placed two orders for sandwiches and they weren't done at the same time, one came out 10 mins after the first, and then when we go to ask the girl making it behind the counter if it would be much longer, she gave my girlfriend entirely too much attitude.

I tried this place again after the manager reached out to me after my original review.  First of all, let me say that the service there on 11/8 at around 1:30 p.m. was great. Both of the people working there were friendly and helpful.  

I ordered a turkey sandwich with mayo and dijon mustard, pepper jack cheese and pretty much all of the vegetables. Their bread was nice and fresh and the turkey was quality meat. All I could taste was the mustard though, so I can't comment on the overall taste.  One thing that stood out was the quality. This isn't Subway/Port of Subs etc. Let's not even mention Quiznos. 

I got the house chips, which I kind of thought that they would make there, but they seem to be just regular ridged potato chips. They remind me of some that I got from Trader Joe's or Fresh and Easy, salt and pepper chips. They have a slightly lemony or limey taste too, which is pretty good. 

Their drink selection is OK.  I have never had Mello Yello and I am not really a soda drinker, so I went with the iced tea, which is obviously from a mix, the Gold Peak kind, which is OK. Their mix was a little off on the tea.  Freshly made real iced tea would have added a star. If you are a soda drinker, know that they have Diet Coke, not Coke Zero. 

I feel like the prices are really reasonable - It was under $10 for my sandwich, chips, and a drink in a reusable cup.  

I would definitely not avoid it, but I didn't love it.  I am planning to try it again to have their salad.

Very unhappy with the service. I normally love this place but after today I'm done going there. They forgot to make my son meal and when we told them they made 7 more sandwiches before my sons meat wraps. My husband had a chicken parmigiana and they put turkey. Very unhappy and will not be going back.

(L)ots of sandwich combinations and selections to choose from and create
(O)nly location in Nevada
(V)ery cool ordering system here-pick a bag, customize it yourself!
(E)xtra premium topping when you use your Yelp check-in offer...SUH WEET!

(T)he spicy mayo has a nice kick to it
(H)ot Pepper mix was something they were out of when we were there....:(
(E)xcellent suggestions from the staff here

(W)hite or Whole Wheat? You decide...option to have it toasted too...:)
(I)f you like to draw, create something on a bag and pin it on the wall
(C)hips go great with your sandwich....get a combo!
(K)ids menu available too
(E)very customer seems to enjoy it here
(D)ouble punch on your stamp card every Monday...Can I get a HELLZ YEAH???

(!)!ALOHA!!!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2013-(10/100) "The Wicked Wich of the Northwest"

We had to get sandwiches the other day, it was the first time I had been here. I love the set up, the employees were all wonderfully friendly and helpful, they were very quick and the dinning area was very clean. Definitely worthy of checking out if you haven't.

I visited here for the first time the other night only because it was right beside the barber shop. Just in the right place at the right time. After my hair cut I walked it and was immediately greeted by the friendly staff. One of the gilrs asked me if I had ever been here and I said "No". She was quick to explain the menu and how it all works which was great. I probably would have been looking at it for hours. I orderd the philly cheese steak as they recommend as the best sandwich. I was very impressed with my meal. It seemed a little over priced as I paid 12 dollars for the combo but I guess you get what you pay for!

It was my first time going there last night and I was so confused.... no one helped me or my bf figure out what we were looking at with all the bags, markers, numbers, and choices.... we're not the brightest couple ha but we figured it out and I was pleased with my order ^.^ all the vegetables were very fresh I couldn't really taste the pesto on the chicken but I order some on the side so it was fine. I would go there again ;)

What the hell happen? I loved this place the first time, now service is slow, the dinning area looked like a school lunchroom mess, and my sandwich almost had some meat on it. What a disappointment in consistency. Not sure I'll be back, but sure glad I got a phone survey on the receipt. Hopefully an a$$ reaming on the review will do some good.
I come here for lunch almost everyday since it's in my plaza. Best sandwiches in town. My personal favorite is The Wicked! I recommend.
Whenever I'm in the neighborhood I stop by and have a pepperoni pizza which.  It is strange since for that price, I can get a pizza...but I still come back for the sandwich :)

Amazing place! Love their Philly cheesesteak you could have it original with provolone or the South Philly Way with cheese whiz. If you enjoy subs and you like to make it the way you prefer this is the place to go!

Customized sandwich!

I got a roast beef sandwich for lunch one day and I love how they give you the option to choose a lettuce wrap instead of buns. For those of us that are watching our carb intake very closely, this makes a huge difference. 

The sandwich was toasted and flavorful, service was decent, and the shop was pretty clean. Easy parking and clean bathrooms.

Went there for the first time today, the system was really easy to figure out, but the lady in front of me didnt seem to think so. My sandwich was really good even though i F'd up and added mayo and mustard, forgetting it comes with thousand island on it. so besides the sauce overload, the turkey tasted great, the bread was warm and toasty. Next time i'll try a milkshake since everyone else that was there was getting one. I took off a star because I wish they had soup.

Ok, I'm upgrading this Sandwich joint to 5 Stars.....why?  Here's why:

I stopped in for lunch and saw their recommended Sandwich of the Week.....a Nachowich (Black Bean Patty, Cheese Whiz, Salsa, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Jalapenos, Avocado)....total with tax & a bag of Chips, $7.95.  It pique'd my interest and went for it, despite not being a Vegetarian.  Of course I added a few things....Pepper Jack Cheese & Hot Pepper Mix.

After a short wait, they called my name and out came my Nachowich.....I took one bite and was in Heaven!  Damn, that's a great Sandwich!  As I said before, I'm not a Vegetarian and unless I'm fasting, I rarely order a Veggie dish.....but took a chance on this recommendation and loved it!
